args: Does this describe a specific, new, official action or formal announcement already taken/made by the Trump administration? Answer only "yes" or "no". Trump threatens tariffs on Russia if it doesn’t end Ukraine war President Donald Trump threatened Wednesday to “put high levels of Taxes, Tariffs, and Sanctions” on Russia if does not reach a deal to end its war in Ukraine. “Let’s get this war, which never would have started if I were President, over with!” Trump wrote on his Truth Social platform. “We can do it the easy way, or the hard way — and the easy is always better.” Trump has been urging Russia for months to wind down the war, which started in 2022 after Russia invaded Ukraine. Trump has a record of issuing tariff threats against countries in an effort to bend them to his will. After winning the November election, he threatened to put new fees on imported goods from Canada and Mexico on his first day in office. But that did not happen Monday, and Trump has since suggested he will issue those tariffs Feb. 1. Trump’s posture toward Russia has been especially notable since he returned to the White House. Trump issued an unusual critique of the country’s president, Vladimir Putin, on Monday, saying he is “destroying Russia” by not making an agreement to end the war. Russian imports to the United States have plummeted amid major U.S. sanctions on Russia over the war. One of President Joe Biden’s last moves in office was to blacklist two of Russia’s largest oil producers and nearly 200 tanker ships. Asked Tuesday whether he would put additional sanctions on Russia if Putin does not stop the war, Trump said it “sounds likely.”
